tit.cmt: 現在は既にない町ですが、他の同様の町も、-choという表現で統一しているので、ここもmizuho-cho としました。

sen.j: 瑞穂町（みずほちょう）は、京都府にあった町である。
sen.e: Mizuho was a town located in Kyoto Prefecture.
Mizuho was a town located in Kyoto Prefecture.
Mizuho-cho was a town located in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日近隣2町と合併し京丹波町となった。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, Mizuho town merged with two neighboring towns, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba town was formed.
On October 11, 2005, Mizuho town merged with two neighboring towns, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba town was formed.
On October 11, 2005, Mizuho-cho merged with two neighboring towns, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba-cho was formed.

sen.j: 1951年4月1日 船井郡桧山村、梅田村、三ノ宮村及び質美村が合併して、瑞穂村として発足。
sen.e: On April 1, 1951, Mizuho village was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Hiyama, Umeda, Sannomiya and Shitsumi from Funai-gun.
sen.cmt: 船井郡桧山村、梅田村、三ノ宮村及び質美村→the villages of Hiyama, Umeda, Sannomiya and Shitsumi from Funai-gun[4つの村すべてが船井郡に位置しています。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北桑田郡の英語版内の表記に合わせました。]
sen.e: On April 1, 1951, Mizuho village was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Hiyama, Umeda, Sannomiya and Shitsumi from Funai-gun.
April 1, 1951: Mizuho-mura was formed as a result of the merger of the villages of Hiyama-mura, Umeda-mura, Sannomiya-mura and Shitsumi-mura of Funai-gun.
sen.cmt: mura を追加しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 1955年4月1日 町制施行により瑞穂町となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1955, Mizuho village was formed as a result of the enforcement of town organization.
On April 1, 1955, Mizuho village was formed as a result of the enforcement of town organization.
April 1, 1955: Mizuho-cho was formed as a result of the enforcement of town organization.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日 丹波町、和知町と合併し京丹波町となった。
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, Mizuho town merged with the towns of Tanba and Wachi, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba town was formed.
sen.cmt: 丹波町、和知町→the towns of Tanba and Wachi[http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/北桑田郡の英語版内の表記に合わせ、表記しました。]
sen.e: On October 11, 2005, Mizuho town merged with the towns of Tanba and Wachi, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba town was formed.
October 11, 2005: Mizuho-cho merged with the towns of Tanba-cho and Wachi-cho, and as a result of this merger, Kyotanba-cho was formed.
sen.cmt: 同上 cho を追加しました。

sen.e: Affiliated cities
Affiliated cities

sen.j: 双葉町 - 福島県双葉郡
sen.e: Futaba town - Futaba-gun, Fukushima Prefecture
Futaba town - Futaba-gun, Fukushima Prefecture
Futaba-cho - Futaba-gun, Fukushima Prefecture

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
